page.title: 11RD TRANSPORT MARTON/N'THORPE
page.content: Nunthorpe and Marton are well served by roads. The main north/south A172 passes through and drivers can suffer long delays and traffic queues at peak commuter times. Marton can be badly affected. There is a plan to possibly build a new relief road from Swan's Corner to Gypsy Lane, and then alongside the railway line into Middlesbrough. The main local traffic arteries are Gypsy Lane and Guisborough Rd. The A171 leads directly from Swans's Corner to Guisborough. The A1043 was specially built to take traffic around Nunthorpe. A survey of the Marton area found that 97% of families who responded owned cars, 93% travelled by car often, 5% not very often, and 2% never. The area has a regular bus service linking the area to Guisborough, Stokesley & Middlesbrough
